data: In the 1970s, the concept of â€œmigraine artâ€ was developed. It refers to the idea that visual art is an appropriate and sometimes the most suitable medium for expressing and communicating the unique experiences of migraine sufferers.
Youâ€™ll find the button to begin the symptom check at the bottom of this pageâ€”after the important disclaimer.
data.-important-disclaimer#âš ï¸ Important Di:
This tool is not a medical diagnosis and is intended for informational purposes only.
Neurological symptoms can have many different causesâ€”some of them serious. This tool assumes that your symptoms are not better explained by another medical condition, such as epilepsy, stroke, multiple sclerosis, or a known eye disorder.
If your symptoms are new, unusual, worsening, or occur alongside other health issues, please seek medical advice immediately.

data.migraine-aura-can-take-many-formssome-we:
This tool is designed to help you explore whether your symptoms align with the internationally recognized diagnostic criteria for migraine aura (ICHD-3).
At the Migraine Aura Foundation, weâ€™ve learned from over 7,000 patient accounts since 2000. While we adhere to current medical standards, we also recognize that science evolvesâ€”and we actively contribute to advancing how migraine aura is understood.
Â

data.#: What were your aura symptoms like?

Which aura symptoms have you experienced? Weâ€™re first checking for one or more fully reversible aura symptoms, as defined by clinical guidelines.
Aura symptoms affect different sensory or functional modalities â€” such as vision, sensation, speech, or movement.
Please select all symptoms youâ€™ve experienced during your aura.
Choose â€œOtherâ€ if youâ€™ve had additional modalities not listed here.
Choose â€œNoneâ€ if none of these apply.
Modalities Visual â“˜ Visual aura often includes flickering lights, zigzag lines, or blind spots. Sensory â“˜ Sensory aura can cause tingling or numbness, usually starting in one hand and moving up the arm. Speech and/or language â“˜ Speech aura can result in difficulty finding words or speaking clearly (dysphasia). Motor â“˜ Motor aura can cause weakness or paralysis, typically on one side of the body. Brainstem â“˜ Brainstem aura includes vertigo, double vision, or unsteady gait without motor weakness. Retinal â“˜ Retinal aura causes repeated attacks of visual disturbance in one eye (monocular). Other â“˜ Other neurological symptoms not listed here but still reversible and aura-like. None Next

Check Other Modalities Clarifying Your â€œOtherâ€ Symptom Does the additional symptom you experienced resemble a known aura modality (e.g., visual, sensory, speech, motor, brainstem, or retinal)? Yes No

data.beyond-the-typical-visual-zigzags#Beyond:
Beyond the Typical Visual Zigzags Migraine aura isnâ€™t only visual â€” for some it is, but many experience effects on speech, sensation, or thinking.
Migraine aura isnâ€™t always temporary â€” conditions like visual snow syndrome can persist well beyond the typical episode.
Migraine aura isnâ€™t always followed by a headache â€” sometimes, the aura stands alone.

data:
While migraine is typically diagnosed through clinical history and the exclusion of other serious causes, the Migraine Aura Foundation highlights the unique diagnostic challenges posed by migraine aura. No blood test, imaging, or procedure can definitively confirm migraineâ€”though such tools may help rule out other conditions. The key remains in gathering a detailed history, supported by structured screening tools.
We advocate for refining this process, especially for aura, where early and accurate recognition possible with the help of digital biomarkers could transform both diagnosis and care.
Check your symptoms

data:
Since 2000, we collected thousands of patient reports of migraine with aura.
With encyclopaedic-worthy detail, we have sorted these reports into 20 basic aura types with over 30 aura subforms.
Â»Every patient with classical migraine opened out, as it were, into an entire encyclopaedia of neurologyÂ« â€“ Oliver Sacks in his book Migraine.
